report.title: Charles II, 1664 & 1665
report.subtitle: Chapter I. An Act for granting a Royall Ayd unto the Kings Majestie of Twenty fower hundred threescore and seaventeene thousand and five hundred Pounds to be raised leavyed and paid in the space of Three Yeares.[Rot. Parl. 16 C. II. nu. 9.]

section.head: Reasons for passing this A&bholigct;.
section.para: Wee Your Majestyes most dutyfull and loyall Subje&bholigct;s the Commons assembled in Parlyament takeing into Consideration the great and apparent Dangers which now threaten this Kingdome, and that for prevention thereof Your Majestie hath found Yourselfe obliged to equip and sett out to Sea a Royall Navy for the preservation of Your Majestyes auntient and undoubted Soveraignty and Dominion in the Seas and the Trade of Your Majestyes Subje&bholigct;s, And haveing duely weighed and considered the severall wayes and meanes by which Your Majestie hath beene enforced to make these Preparations at soe vast an Expence And acknowledging with all humility and thankfulnes Your Majestyes abundant Care for our Preservation and being deepely sensible of that extraordinary Charge and Expence with which Your Majestyes present Engagement ought to be supported, and of those Inconveniencies which must needs befall the Nation if we should be wanting to ourselves in this soe weighty and important Occasion, have chearefully and unanimously given and granted, and doe hereby give and grant unto Your most Excellent Majestie the summe of Twenty fower hundred threescore and seaventeene thousand and five hundred Pounds to be raised and leavyed in manner following, And doe humbly beseech Your Majestie That it may be ena&bholigct;ed, And bee it enacted by the Kings most excellent Majestie by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spirituall and Temporall and of the Commons in this present Parlyament assembled and by Authoritie of the same That for the righting of Your Majestie and Your Majestyes Subje&bholigct;s against the Dutch the summe of twenty fower hundred threescore and seaventeene thousand and five hundred Pounds shall be raised leavyed and paid unto your Majestie within the space of Three Yeares in manner following that is to say The summe of Threescore and eight thousand eight hundred and nineteene pounds and nine shillings by the Moneth for Thirty six Moneths begining from the Five and twentyeth day of December(1) One thousand six hundred sixty fower shall be assessed taxed, colle&bholigct;ed, levyed and paid by Twelve quarterly payments in the severall Countyes Cittyes Burroughes Townes and places within England and Wales and the Towne of Berwicke upon Tweede according to the severall rules and proportions and in such manner as is hereafter expressed that is to say for every Moneth of the said Thirty six Moneths,
For the County of Bedford the summe of Eight hundred ninety six pounds seaventeene shillings and nine pence.
The County of Berks the summe of One thousand one hundred thirty two pounds six shillings and seaven pence.

section.head: II. Commissioners for Counties, &c.
section.para: And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed by the Authoritie aforesaid That all and every the persons hereafter named shall be Commissioners of and for the severall and respective Countyes Cittyes Burroughes Townes and Places hereafter named that is to say.

section.head: III. Commissioners to meet 10th March;
section.para: and may divide themselves.

And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed and declared that the severall C&bhooov;mis?ers aforesaid shall meete together at the most usuall and c&bhooov;mon place of meeting within each of the said Countyes Cittyes Burrouphes Townes and Places respe&bholigct;ively on or before the tenth day of March now next ensueing And the said C&bhooov;mis?ers or soe many of them as shall be present at the said First Generall Meeting or the major part of them are hereby authorized and required to putt this [Present 54] A&bholigct; in execution according to the best of their Judgements and Discretions and shall then if they see cause subdivide and distribute themselves soe into lesser numbers as two or more of the said C&bhooov;mis?ers may be appointed for the service of each Hundred or other Division and as may best conduce to the carrying on of His Majestyes Service hereby required.

section.head: IV. Commissioners at their First Meeting to agree what Number are to a&bholigct; in each Division.
section.para: And for the more effe&bholigct;uall performance thereof Bee it ena&bholigct;ed and declared That the C&bhooov;mis?ers at the aforesaid First Generall Meeting or the major part of them shall agree and sett downe in writeing who and what number of the said C&bhooov;mis?ers shall a&bholigct; in each of the said Divisions or Hundreds To the end that there be noe failure in any part of the due execution of the Service by this A&bholigct; required.

section.head: V. Two Commissioners may cause Proportions charged on Divisions to be taxed, and to appoint Assessors,
section.para: The Duty of Assessors.

And bee it ena&bholigct;ed and declared [by the Authority aforesaid 54] That the C&bhooov;mis?ers within the severall Divisions or Hundreds or any Two or more of them are hereby authorized and required to cause the said severall Proportions charged on the respe&bholigct;ive Divisions and on every Parish and Place therein for the said three yeares Assessment to be equally assessed and taxed and to appoint two or more Assessors in each Parish or Place for the perfe&bholigct;ing thereof who are hereby required with all care and diligence to assesse the same equally by a Pound rate upon all Lands Tenements Hereditaments Annuities Rents Parkes Warrens Goods Chattells Stocke Merchandize Offices other then Judiciall and Military Offices and Offices relateing to the Navy under the Command of the Lord High Admirall and Offices within his Majestyes Household Tolls Proffitts and all other Estates both reall and personall within the Limitts Circuits and Bounds of their respe&bholigct;ive Parishes and Places.

section.head: VI. First Payment to Receiver General, and by him into the Exchequer.
section.para: Second; Third; Fourth; Fifth; Sixth; Seventh; Eighth.; Ninth.; Tenth.; Eleventh.; Twelfth.

And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed by the Authority aforesaid That the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the first of the said Twelve quarterly payments hereby imposed shall be assessed colle&bholigct;ed leavyed and paid into the Receivour Generall of the said severall Countyes who shall be appointed by His Majestie And who are hereby required to transmitt or cause the same to be paid into His Majestyes Receipt of His Exchequer on or before the First day of May in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty and five And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the second of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of August in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty five, And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings and eight pence being the third of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of November in the yeare of one Lord One thousand six hundred sixty five, And the sume of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings [and 55] eight pence being the fourth of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of February in the yeare of our. Lord One thousand six hundred sixty five, And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the fifth of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of May in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty six, And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the sixth of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of August in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty six And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the seaventh of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of November in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty six And the Summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the eighth of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of February in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty six, And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the ninth of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of May in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty seaven, And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the tenth of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of August in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty seaven, And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the eleaventh of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of November in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty seaven, And the summe of Two hundred and six thousand fower hundred and fifty and eight pounds six shillings eight pence being the twelfth of the said Quarterly payments on or before the First day of February in the yeare of our Lord One thousand six hundred sixty seaven:

section.head: VII. Assessors to deliver a Copy of Assessment subscribed by them to Commissioners, who are to sign and seal Two Duplicates thereof, and deliver one to Sub-colle&bholigct;or,
section.para: and the other to Receiver General, who is to transmit the same to the Exchequer.

And for the compleating of the whole summe charged upon the same, and to the end the aforesaid summes charged upon the severall and respe&bholigct;ive Countyes Cittyes Burroughes Townes and places may be equally and indifferently assessed according to the true intent of this A&bholigct; and the money duely colle&bholigct;ed and true acompt thereof made the said Assessors are hereby required to deliver one Copy of their respe&bholigct;ive Assesments fairly written and subscribed by them unto the said C&bhooov;mis?ers and the said C&bhooov;mis?ers or any two or more of them are hereby ordered and required to signe and seale two Duplicates of the said Assesments, and the one of them to deliver or cause to be delivered to one or more honest and responsable person or persons to be Sub colle&bholigct;or or Sub Colle&bholigct;ors which the said C&bhooov;mis?ers are hereby authorized to nominate and appoint for each Parish or place with Warrant to the said Sub Colle&bholigct;or or Sub Colle&bholigct;ors to colle&bholigct; the said Assesment payable as aforesaid soe as the said severall summes may be paid in to the said Receivers Generall and by them into the Receipt of his Majesties Exchequer at the respe&bholigct;ive times aforesaid and the said C&bhooov;mis?ers are hereby required to deliver or cause to be delivered the other of the said Duplicates of each Parish or place to the Receivour Generall of each County Citty Towne or place respe&bholigct;ively to be by him the said Receivour Generall transmitted into the Kings Remembrancers Office in the Exchequer which the said Receiver Generall is required to performe accordingly

section.head: VIII. Head Colle&bholigct;or to be appointed by Commissioners.

para.emph: Head Colle&bholigct;or to pay to Receiver General.

section.para: And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed and declared That the said C&bhooov;mi?ers in their respe&bholigct;ive Divisions or Hundreds or any two or more of them shall and are hereby impowered to nominate and appoint under their Hands and Seales an honest able and responsable person to bee Head colle&bholigct;or unto whom the moneyes received by the Sub colle&bholigct;or within the Division or Hundred shall from time to time be duely paid, And the said Head colle&bholigct;or is hereby required upon the receipt thereof to pay the same forthwith to the Receivour Generall of each County respe&bholigct;ively

section.head: IX. Collectors to pay to the Receivers General, who are to transmit Monies to the Exchequer.
section.para: Salary to Receiver General.; What the Duplicate to be returned into the Exchequer is to contain.

And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed and declared That the perticular Colle&bholigct;ors and Sub Colle&bholigct;ors are hereby required to pay in all and every the summes soe received by them to the said Receivors Generall aforesaid who are hereby required [forthwith 56] to transmitt or cause to be paid the moneyes by them received into the Receipt of his Majesties Exchequer, And the said Lord Tre?r is hereby authorized to allow the said Receivour Generall of each County Citty and Towne respe&bholigct;ively in case he hath returned up as aforesaid a Duplicate of the Assesment. of each Parish or place in County Citty or Towne for which he is appointed Receivour Generall a Sallary for his paines not exceeding one penny in the pound upon the clearing of his Accompt which Duplicate soe to be returned into the Kings Remembrancers Office in the Exchequer is intended to containe noe more then the summes in grosse to be colle&bholigct;ed by each Sub Colle&bholigct;or and the severall Names of the said Sub Colle&bholigct;ors.

section.head: X. Allowance to Sub-colle&bholigct;ors 1d. in the Pound, to be paid by Head Colle&bholigct;ors.
section.para: Allowance to Head Colle&bholigct;ors 1d. in the Pound, to be paid by Receiver General.; Allowance to Commissioners Clerks 1d. in the Pound, to be paid by Receiver General.

And it is hereby further ena&bholigct;ed and declared that the Sub Colle&bholigct;ors of each Parish or place which shall be appointed by vertue of this A&bholigct; shall (57) upon colle&bholigct;ion of the whole Summe appointed to be colle&bholigct;ed by them and payment thereof as is hereby and before appointed have and receive for their paines in colle&bholigct;ing and paying the moneyes one penny in the pound which the said severall Head Colle&bholigct;ors are hereby authorized to pay unto them, and the severall Head Colle&bholigct;ors which shall be appointed by vertue of this A&bholigct; shall upon the payment of the whole summe due from their Hundred or Division to the Receiver Generall of each County have and receive for their paines in receiving and paying the said moneyes one penny in the pound which each [Receiour58] Generall is hereby authorized to pay and allow unto them accordingly, and alsoe upon Receipt of the whole Assesment of the County Citty or Towne for which he is appointed Receivour Generall in case he hath, received the severall Duplicates of each Parish or place therein and not otherwise to allow and pay according to such Warrant as shall be in that behalfe given by the said C&bhooov;mis?ers or any three of them one penny in the pound for the C&bhooov;mis?ers Clerkes for their paines in faire writeing the Assesments Duplicates and Copies.

section.head: XI. No Head Colle&bholigct;ors to be appointed in Cities, &c. where there is a Receiver General, except London.
section.para: Provided That noe Head Colle&bholigct;ors shall be appointed for any Citty or Towne which is by this A&bholigct; perticularly charged with the payment of any summe towards the Assesment hereby to be levyed and for which a Receivour Generall is to be appointed excepting within the Citty of London.

section.head: XII. Refusing to pay Assessment ;

para.emph: Distress; Colle&bholigct;ors, &c. in the Day-time may break open Houses, Chests, &c. upon Warrant from Commissioners, calling to their Assistance Constables, &c. who are to be aiding; Commissioners to settle Questions arising upon Distress.; Refusing, &c. to pay, conveying away Goods, &c. Imprisonment.; Proviso for Peers.

section.para: And be it ena&bholigct;ed and declared That if any person shall refuse or negle&bholigct; to pay any summe of money whereat he shall be rated or assessed That then it shall and may be lawfull to and for the said Colle&bholigct;ors Subcolle&bholigct;ors or any of them who are hereby authorized and required thereunto to leavy the summe assessed by, distresse and sale of the Goods of such persons soe refuseing or negcle&bholigct;ing to pay dedu&bholigct;ing the summe assessed and reasonable charges of destraining and restore the Overplus to the Owner thereof And to breake open in the. day time any house, and upon Warrant under the Hands and Seales of two or more of the said C&bhooov;mis?ers any Chest Trunke or Box or other things where any such Goods are and to call to their assistance the Constables, Tythingmen and Headboroughes within the Countyes Cittyes Townes or places where any refusall negcle&bholigct; or resistance shall be made which said Officers and Forces are hereby required to be aiding and assisting in the Premisses as they will answere the contrary at their perrills, And if any question or difference happen upon takeing of such Distresses betweene the partyes distressed or distrained the same shall be ended and determined by the said C&bhooov;mis?ers or any two or more of them, And if any person or persons shall refuse or negcle&bholigct; to pay his or their Assesment and convey his or their Goods or other personall Estate whereby the summe of money soe assessed cannot be levyed according to this A&bholigct; then the respe&bholigct;ive C&bhooov;mis?ers or any two or more of them are hereby authorized to imprison the person (except a Peere or Peeres of this Realme) and him and them in Prison to detaine and keepe untill the money soe assessed and the charges for the bringing in the same be paid and satisfied and noe longer.

section.head: XIII. Tenants may pay the Tax and dedu&bholigct; out of Rent.
section.para: Landlords to allow Dedu&bholigct;ion.

And the severall and respe&bholigct;ive Tenants or Tenant of all Houses and Lands which shall be rated by vertue of this A&bholigct; are hereby required and authorized to pay such Summe or Summes of Money as shall be rated upon such House or Lands and to dedu&bholigct; out of the Rent soe much of the said Rates as in respe&bholigct; of the said Rents of every such House and Lands the Landlord should or ought to pay and beare And the said Landlords' both mediate and i&bhomov;ediate according to their respe&bholigct;ive Interests are hereby required to allow such Dedu&bholigct;ions and Payments upon the receipt of the residue of the Rents.

section.head: XIV. Acquittance to Tenant paying.
section.para: Commissioners to decide Differences between Landlord and Tenant.

And it is ena&bholigct;ed and declared That every Tenant paying the said Assessment shall be acquitted and discharged for soe much Money as the said Assesment shall amount unto as if the same had beene a&bholigct;ually paid unto such person or persons unto whom his Rents should have beene due and payable And if any difference shall arise betweene Landlord and Tennant or any other concerning the said Rates the said severall Co&bhooov;mis?ers or any two or more of them in their severall Divisions shall and have hereby power to setle the same as they shall thinke fitt,

section.head: XV. Persons over-rated Commissioners may relieve.

para.emph: If Proportions not fully assessed, or Persons charged not of Ability, or Assessment on empty House, or Assessment not paid to Receiver General; Re-assessment, &c.

section.para: And if any person or persons shall finde him or themselves agreved in that the Assessors have overrated him or them and shall within six dayes after demand made of the summe of money assessed on him or them complaine to two or more Co&bhooov;mis?ers whereof one of the Co&bhooov;mis?ers who signed or allowed his or their Assesment to be one, the said Co&bhooov;mis?ers or any two or more of them shall have and have hereby power within Twelve dayes after the demand of the Assessment as aforesaid to releive such person or persons and to charge the same on such other person or persons as they shall see cause, And in case the proportions sett by this A&bholigct; upon all and every the respe&bholigct;ive Countyes Cittyes Townes and Places shall not be fully assessed leavyed and paid according to the true meaning thereof or that if any of the said Assessments shall be rated and imposed upon any person not being of ability to pay the same, or upon any empty or void House or Land where the same [can59] not be colle&bholigct;ed or levyed, or that through any wilfulnes negligence or mistake or accident the said Assesment charged upon each County Citty Towne or Place by vertue of this A&bholigct; happens not to be paid to the Receivour Generall of the respe&bholigct;ive Countyes as in this A&bholigct; is directed that then in all and every such cases the severall and respe&bholigct;ive Co&bhooov;mis?ers Assessors and Colle&bholigct;ors aforesaid and every of them respe&bholigct;ively are hereby authorized and required to assesse or reassesse or cause to be assessed or reassessed levyed and paid all and every such summe or summes of money upon the respective Countyes Cittyes Townes and Places or upon any of the Divisions Hundreds and Parishes therein as to the said Co&bhooov;mis?ers or such number of them as by this A&bholigct; are authorized to cause the first Assesment hereby required to be made shall seeme most agreable to equity and justice, the said new Assesment to be made colle&bholigct;ed and paid in such manner and by such meanes as in this A&bholigct; for this Assesment is declared and dire&bholigct;ed.

section.head: XVI. Officers neglecting Duty;

para.emph: Commissioners may fine, not exceeding £20; Fines paid to Receiver General, and by him into Exchequer.

section.para: And be it further ena&bholigct;ed and declared by the Authoritie aforesaid That if any person or persons shall wilfully negcle&bholigct; or refuse to performe his or their duty in the [true60] and speedy execution of this present A&bholigct; the said respe&bholigct;ive C&bhooov;mis?ers or any Three or more of them have hereby power to impose on such person or persons soe refuseing or negcle&bholigct;ing their dutyes such Fine or Fines as to them shall be thought fitt and to cause the same to be levyed by Distresse and Sale of his and their Goods Provided that noe Fine to be imposed by any of the said Co&bhooov;mis?ers shall for any one Offence exceed the summe of Twenty pounds, And that all Fines that shall be imposed by vertue of this A&bholigct; shall be paid to the respe&bholigct;ive Receivours Generall and by them to the Receipt of His Majestyes Exchequer

section.head: XVII. Collector not paying Monies received by him;
section.para: Commissioners may imprison and seize Real and Personal Estate; and may appoint a general Meeting of Commissioners on Notice; and if Monies not paid, may sell the said Estates for Payment, of Commreturning Overplus,.

And it is further enacted and declared That if any Colle&bholigct;or or Subcollector that shall by vertue of this Act be appointed for the receipt of any summe or summes of money thereby to be assessed shall negcle&bholigct; or refuse to pay any summe or summes of money which shall by him be received as aforesaid and not pay the same as in and by this A&bholigct; is dire&bholigct;ed and shall detaine in his or their hands any money received by them or any of them and not pay the same as by this A&bholigct; is dire&bholigct;ed, the Comissers of each County Citty or Towne respe&bholigct;ively or any Two or more of them in their respe&bholigct;ive Divisions are hereby authorized and impowered to imprison the person and seize and secure the Estate both reall and personall of such Colle&bholigct;or or Subcolle&bholigct;or to them respe&bholigct;ively belonging or which shall descend or come into the hands or possession of their Heires Executors or Administrators where ever the same can be discovered and found, And the said Co&bhooov;mis?ers who shall soe seize and secure the Estate of any Colle&bholigct;or or Subcollector shall be and are hereby impowered to appoint a time for the Generall Meeting of the [said61] Co&bhooov;mis?ers of such County Citty or Towne and there to cause publique notice to be given at the place where such Meeting shall be appointed ten dayes at least before such Generall Meeting, and the Co&bhooov;mis?ers present at such Generall Meeting or the major part of them in case the moneyes detained by Colle&bholigct;ors or Subcolle&bholigct;ors be not paid or satisfied as it ought to be according to the directions of this A&bholigct; shall and are hereby impowered and required to sell and dispose of all such Estates which shall be for the cause aforesaid seised and secured or any part of them and satisfie and pay such County and Place the Summe that shall be soe detained in the hands of such Colle&bholigct;or or Subcollector and returne the Overplus deducting necessary charges to such Colle&bholigct;or or Subcolle&bholigct;or their Heires Executors and Administrators respe&bholigct;ively.

section.head: XVIII. Commissioners to call Collectors, &c; before them to account;

para.emph: and in case of Failure of Monies, to levy the same forthwith.

section.para: And it is hereby further enacted and declared That at the expiration of the respe&bholigct;ive times in this A&bholigct; prescribed for the full payment of the said quarterly Assesments the severall and respe&bholigct;ive Co&bhooov;mis?ers or any Two of them within their Division and Hundred shall and are hereby required to call before them the cheife Colle&bholigct;ors and Subcolle&bholigct;ors within each respective Division and Hundred to examine and assure themselves of the full and whole payment of the perticular Summe and Summes of Money charged upon the said Division Hundred and every Parish and Place therein and of the due Returne of the same into the Hands of the Receivour Generall of the said County Citty Towne and Place respe&bholigct;ively, And by such Receivour Generall to the Receipt of His Majestyes Exchequer to the end there may be noe failure in the payment of any part of the Assesment by vertue of this Act to be assessed and paid nor any Arreares remaine chargeable upon any [the said62] Countyes Cittyes Townes or Places respe&bholigct;ively And in case of any failure in the Premisses the said Co&bhooov;mis?ers or any Two of them are hereby to cause the same to be forthwith leavyed and paid according to the true intent and meaning of this A&bholigct;.

section.head: XIX. Commissioners not to vote in their own Case.
section.para: And it is hereby, ena&bholigct;ed and declared That in case any Controversy arise concerning the said Assesments or the dividing apportioning or payment thereof which concerne any of the Co&bhooov;mis?ers by this A&bholigct; appointed, that the C&bhooov;mis?ers soe concerned in the said Controversie shall have noe Voice but shall withdraw at the time of the Debate of any such Controversie untill it be determined by the rest of the Co&bhooov;mis?ers.

section.head: XX. Privileged Places, &c. liable.

para.emph: Tenants of Fee Farm Rents, &c. to pay.; Indemnity to such Tenants.

section.para: And bee it hereby ena&bholigct;ed and declared That noe Priviledge Place or Person Body Pollitique or Corporate within the Countyes Cittyes and Townes aforesaid shall be exempted from the said Assessments and Taxes and that they and every of them and alsoe all Fee Farme Rents and all other manner of Rents Payments Summes of Moneyes and Annuities issueing out of any Lands within Citty or County shall be lyeable towards the payment of every Summe by this A&bholigct; to be taxed and leavyed, And all the Tennants of any Fee Farme Rent other Rent summes of Money or Annuityes aforesaid are hereby dire&bholigct;ed and authorized to pay them proportionably according to the Rates and Assesments by this A&bholigct; appointed and dire&bholigct;ed And all such Tennants shall be hereby saved and kepte harmelesse by authoritie of this A&bholigct; from any further payment of such portion of (62) such Rent Rents Summes or Annuityes either to the Exchequer or to any other person or persons to whom any such Rent Rents Summes of Moneyes or Annuityes as aforesaid should or ought to be paid to all intents and purposes whatsoever as fully and as amply as if they had paid the same into the Exchequer or to any person or persons to whom the same is reserved or become due

section.head: XXI. Proviso for Universities, Colleges of Windsor, Eaton, &c. Hospitals, &c.

para.emph: and for Christ's Hospital, and other Hospitals in London and Southwark.

section.para: Provided That noe thing contained in this A&bholigct; shall be extended to charge any Colledge or Hall in either of the Universities or the Colledges of Windsor Eaton Winton or Westminster or any Hospitalls for or in respe&bholigct; of the Scites of the said Colledges [or63] Halls or Hospitalls nor any Master Fellow or Scholler of any such Colledge or Hall or in any other Free Schooles or any Reader Officer or Minister of the said Universities Colledges or Schooles or of any Hospitalls or Almes houses for or in respe&bholigct; of any stipend wages or proffitt whatsoever ariseing or growing due to them in respe&bholigct; of the said severall Places and Imployments in the said Universities Colledges Schooles Hospitalls or Almeshouses nor to charge any of the Houses or Lands belonging to Christs Hospitall St Bartholimews Bridewell St Thomas and Bethlem Hospitall in the Citty of London and Burrough of Southwarke or any of them for or in respe&bholigct; of any Rents or Revenues payable to the said Hospitalls being to be received and disbursed for the immediate use and releife of the poore in the said Hospitalls.

section.head: XXII. Tenants of such Hospitals to pay.
section.para: Provided That noe Tennants that hold or enjoy any Lands or Houses by Lease or any other grant from any of the said Hospitalls doe claime and enjoy any freedome exemption or advantage by this A&bholigct; but that all the Houses and Lands which they soe hold shall be rated and assessed for soe much as they are yearely worth over and above the Rents reserved and payable to the said Hospitalls.

section.head: XXIII. Persons in London to be taxed in Parish where they live for Goods, &c. in other Parishes, &c.
section.para: Provided alsoe That where any person inhabiting within the Citty of London hath his Dwelling house in one of the Parishes or Wards therein and hath any Goods Wares or Merchandize in one or more of the other Parishes or Wards within the same that then such person shall be charged taxed and assessed for such his Goods or Merchandize in the Parish or Ward where he dweleth and not elsewhere in the said Citty.

section.head: XXIV. The whole Sum to be levied.
section.para: Commissioners to account.

Provided neverthelesse That noe Clause or Provisoe in this A&bholigct; shall extend to the lessening or abatement of the full summe by this A&bholigct; appointed to be taxed leavyed and paid but that the same be fully assessed taxed levyed colle&bholigct;ed and paid in the severall and respe&bholigct;ive Countyes Cittyes and Townes aforesaid in such manner and forme and to such uses as is herein before mentioned and declared. And that the severall and respe&bholigct;ive Co&bhooov;mis?ers and every of them shall from time to time give a true and perfe&bholigct; Accompt of all their doeings and proceedings in the execution of this A&bholigct; to the said Lord Treasurer or to other such persons as His Majestie shall appoint.

section.head: XXV. In case assessing by a Pound Rate prove prejudicial, then Commissioners to assess by an usual Rate.
section.para: Provided alwayes and bee it hereby ena&bholigct;ed and declared That in case the way or manner of assessing by a Pound rate shall prove any way prejudiciall or obstru&bholigct;ive to the said speedy bringing in of the Assesment or any part thereof appointed by this A&bholigct; that then and in all such cases the respe&bholigct;ive Co&bhooov;mis?ers or any two of them are hereby authorized to order and dire&bholigct; their respe&bholigct;ive Assessors who are hereby required to proceede accordingly to assesse the respe&bholigct;ive summes charged on the respe&bholigct;ive Countyes Cittyes and Burroughes Townes and Places mentioned in this A&bholigct; according to the most just and usuall way of Rates held and pra&bholigct;ised in such Countyes Cittyes Burroughes Townes and places respe&bholigct;ively Any thing in this A&bholigct; to the contrary thereof contained in any wise notwithstanding

section.head: XXVI. Proviso for Covenants, &c. between Landlord and Tenant.
section.para: Provided alwayes That noe thing in this A&bholigct; contained shall be construed to alter change determine or make void any Contra&bholigct;s Covenants or Agreements whatsoever betweene the Landlord and Tennant touching the payment of Taxes or Assesments Any thing herein before mentioned to the contrary notwithstanding.

section.head: XXVII. Places rated to pay and he assessed in such County, &c. as heretofore.
section.para: Provided alwayes and be it further ena&bholigct;ed and declared by the Authority aforesaid That for the avoiding of all obstru&bholigct;ions and delayes in colle&bholigct;ing the summes by this A&bholigct; to be rated and assessed all Places Constablewicks Divisions and Allotments which have used to be rated and assessed shall pay and be assessed in such County Hundred Rape and Wapentake as the same hath heretofore usually beene assessed in and not elsewhere.

section.head: XXVIII. In A&bholigct;ion for executing A&bholigct; General Issue may be pleaded.
section.para: And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed by the Authority aforesaid That if any A&bholigct;ion Plaint Suite or Information shall be commenced or prosecuted against any person or persons for what he or they shall doe in pursuance or in execution of this A&bholigct; such person or persons [soe sued in any Court63] whatsoever shall or may pleade the Generall Issue Not guilty And upon any Issue joyned may give this A&bholigct; and the speciall matter in Evidence And if the Plaintiffe or Prosecutor shall become Non suite or forbeare further Prosecution or suffer Discontinuance or if a Verdi&bholigct; passe against him the Defendants shall recover their Treble Costs for which they shall have the like remedy as in any case where Costs by the Law are given to Defendants.

section.head: XXIX. Proviso in respe&bholigct; of a Decree in Chancery, as to Lands in Sheriff Hales in the County of Salop.
section.para: Provided alwayes That noe thing in this A&bholigct; shall extend or be construed to invalidate a Decree lately made in the High Court of Chauncery for the quieting of Suites betweene the Counties of Salop and Stafford and for the setleing all future Payments to be imposed on certaine Lands in Sheriffe Hales with the County of Salop And for exempting the said Lands from paying hereafter with the County of Stafford But that the said Decree shall remaine in such (and noe other) force as it did before the makeing of this A&bholigct; Any thing herein to the contrary notwithstanding.

section.head: XXX. Spiritual Revenues chargeable by this A&bholigct; to be discharged from the two last of the Four Subsidies granted by the Clergy, by 15 Car. II. c. 10.
section.para: Provided alwayes and be it ena&bholigct;ed by the Authoritie aforesaid That all Spirituall Promotions and all Lands Possessions or Revenues annexed to and all Goods and Chattells growing or renewed upon the same or elsewhere appertaining to the Owners of the said Spirituall Promotions or any of them which are or shall be charged or made contributary by this A&bholigct; towards the Payments aforesaid dureing the time therein appointed shall be absolutely freed and discharged from the two last of the fower Subsidyes granted by the Clergy to His Majestie His Heires and Successors by an A&bholigct; made in a former Session of this present Parlyament entituled An A&bholigct; for confirming of fower Subsidyes granted by the Clergy Any clause or thing in the said A&bholigct; to the contrary notwithstanding.

section.head: XXXI. Head Colle&bholigct;ors to give Acquittances to Sub-colle&bholigct;ors without Fee.

para.emph: Receivers General to give Acquittances to Head Colle&bholigct;ors without Fee.; Such Acquittances to be a full Discharge to such Colle&bholigct;ors, and also to Place, &c. charged.

section.para: Provided alwayes and be it ena&bholigct;ed by the Authoritie aforesaid That the severall Head Colle&bholigct;ors which shall be appointed according to this A&bholigct; shall from time to time at every Payment appointed thereby give unto the severall Sub Colle&bholigct;ors within their respe&bholigct;ive Precin&bholigct;s upon the Payment of the whole Summe due at such times of Payment from their respe&bholigct;ive Parishes Constablewicks or places within each of their Colle&bholigct;ions severall Acquittances under their Hands without takeing any thing for the same And that in like manner at every time of payment appointed by this A&bholigct; the Receivour Generall of each County shall give unto the severall Headcolle&bholigct;ors aforesaid upon the payment of the whole Summe due for their Hundred or Division respe&bholigct;ively at each time [of payment64] aforesaid severall Acquittances under their Hands and Seales without takeing any thing for the same which said Acquittances of the Headcolle&bholigct;ors shall be a full and perfe&bholigct; discharge to the Sub Colle&bholigct;ors. And the said Acquittances of the Receivour Generall shall be a sufficient discharge to the Headcolle&bholigct;ors and to such Hundred Division Constablewicke Parish or place respe&bholigct;ively and to every person charged within the said Sub Colle&bholigct;ors or Head Colle&bholigct;ors Charge against His Majestie His Heires and Successors for the summe or summes of money soe acquitted

section.head: XXXII. Remedy against Land or House void of Distress.
section.para: Provided alwayes and be it further ena&bholigct;ed That in case any Lands or Houses in any Parish Place or Constablewicke shall lye unoccupyed and noe distresse can be found on the same by reason whereof the said Parish Place or Constablewicke are forced to pay and make good the Taxe assessed upon such Lands lyeing unoccupyed That then it shall and may be lawfull at any time [after64] for the Colle&bholigct;ors Constable or Tythingman of the said Parish Place or Constablewicke for the time being to enter and destraine upon the said Lands and Houses when there shall be any Distresse thereupon to be found, And the Distresse and Distresses being the proper Goods of the Owner or any claiming any Estate Interest or Proffitt under him if not redeemed within fower dayes by payment of the Tax and Charge of (65) Distresse to sell rendering the Overplus to the Owners or Owners of such Distresse, And the said Colle&bholigct;or Constable or Tythingman is hereby enjoyned to distribute the money raised by the said Distresse or Sale thereof proportionably to the partyes who contributed to the Taxe of the said unoccupyed Lands

section.head: XXXIII. When Woodlands assessed, and no Distress, Subcolle&bholigct;ors, &c. may cut and sell to pay Assessment.
section.para: Provided alwayes and be it ena&bholigct;ed that where any Woodlands shall be assessed and noe Distresse can be had that in such case it shall and may be lawfull to and for any Sub Colle&bholigct;or Constable [Headborough64] or Tythingman by Warrant under the Hands and Seales of two or more of the Co&bhooov;mis?ers in that Hundred or Division at seasonable time of the yeare to cutt and sell to any person or persons soe much of the Wood growing on the said Woodlands soe assessed as will pay the Assesment [and66] Assesments soe behinde and unpaid and the Charge incident thereto, And that it shall and may be lawfull for the person and persons and his Assignee to whom such Wood shall be soe sold to sell cutt downe dispose and carry away the same to his owne use rendering the Overplus if any be to the Owner Any Law to the contrary notwithstanding

section.head: XXXIV. Where Assessment on Tithes and other Profits not distrainable not paid, Sub-colle&bholigct;or, &c. may seize and sell.
section.para: Provided alwayes and be it further ena&bholigct;ed That where any Taxe or Assesment shall be charged or laid upon any Tythes Tolls Proffitts of Markets Faires or Fishery or other Annuall Proffitts not destrainable in case the same shall not be paid within fifteene dayes after such Assesment soe charged or laid and demanded then it shall be lawfull to and for the Sub Colle&bholigct;or Constable or other Officer thereunto appointed by Warrant under the Hands and Seales of any two or more of the Co&bhooov;mis?ers authorized by this A&bholigct; to seise take and sell soe much of the said Tythes Tolls and other Proffitts soe charged as shall be sufficient for the leavying of the said Taxe and Assesment and all Charges occasioned by such Non payment thereof rendering the Overplus to the Owner if any be.

section.head: XXXV. Commissioners for Middlesex and Westminster may appoint Assessors.

para.emph: who are to ascertain and rate Offices, Townships, &c. chargeable, and to return the same to the Commissioners.; Such Assessors to deliver in their Surveys signed to Commissioners.; Commissioners at General Meeting, on Perusal of Surveys, are to cast up the true Revenue of the County, &c., and to apportion a Pound Rate.

section.para: And whereas the County of Midlesex and Citty of Westminster are raised in the Monethly Assesment by reason of the new buildings lately ere&bholigct;ed And that Offices are made chargeable towards the payment of such Assesment To the end that an equall rate may be made and imposed upon the severall Divisions Parishes and Hamblets within the said County and Citty Bee it ena&bholigct;ed by this present Parliament and by the Authority thereof That the said C&bhooov;missers appointed for the said County and Citty of Westminster [or any Three of them67] shall if they shall thinke it fitt cause two or three of the honest and able Inhabitants in the severall and respe&bholigct;ive Parishes Towneshipps and Places within the said County and Citty to be named and appointed Assessors who (or any two of them) are to ascertaine and rate the yearely value and proffitts of all Offices belonging to the Courts of Westminster and other Offices chargeable by this A&bholigct; towards the payment of the said summe sett upon the said County and Citty and all Towneshipps Parishes and Places for which they be appointed Assessors and to returne the same to the said C&bhooov;mis?sers or to such person or persons as shall be appointed to receive the same, which said Assessors are to deliver in their severall Surveyes perfe&bholigct;ed and subscribed by them unto the said C&bhooov;mis?ners or to such [other68] person or persons as shall be appointed by them or any three of them to receive the same two or three dayes at the least before the second Generall Meeting of the said C&bhooov;mis?ers to the end that the said C&bhooov;mis?ers may deliver in all the severall Surveyes to be made throughout the said County at the said second Generall Meeting, at which said Generall Meeting the, said Co&bhooov;mis?ers or the major part of them then present shall upon view and perusall of the said severall Surveyes cast up the true revenue and yearely proffitts of the whole County Citty and Offices aforesaid to the end that an equall Pound rate may be apportioned upon every Office chargeable by this A&bholigct; Division Hundred Towneship and Parish according to the proportion and summe of money charged upon the said County and Citty by vertue of this present A&bholigct; which the said Co&bhooov;mis?ers or the major part of them then and there assembled are by vertue of this A&bholigct; authorized and appointed to [apportion69] and make accordingly.

section.head: XXXVI. Proviso for Rights of Peers, Clergy, Universities, &c.
section.para: [Provided alwayes That noe thing herein contained shall be drawne into example to the prejudice of the Auntient Rights belonging unto the Lords Spirituall and Temporall or Clergy of this Realme or unto either of the Universityes or unto any Colledges Schooles Almeshouses Hospitalls or Cinque Ports.,70]
section.note: This Name is illegible on the Roll.
Court O. the name is not clearly legible on the Roll.
